items.title: 5G Technology Will Help American Manufacturers Stay Competitive
New Motion Control Tech Increases Flexibility
New Fastening Technology Improves Ergonomics, Throughput
Final Subaru Legacy Rolls Off Indiana Assembly Line
Honda Discontinues GM-Built Acura ZDX Amid EV Market Headwinds
New Adhesives, Dispensing Tech Improve Bonding
Lockheed Martin Unveils Vectis Collaborative Combat Aircraft
items.summary:
- *Lockheed Martin* introduced *Vectis*, a **Group 5** collaborative combat aircraft designed for *survivability, flexibility,* and *cost-effectiveness*.  
- Vectis is a **stealth-enabled drone** capable of multiple roles, including *precision strike*, *ISR*, *electronic warfare*, and *counter-air*, integrating with **fifth-generation** fighters like the *F-35*.  
- Utilizing **digital engineering** and **advanced manufacturing**, Lockheed aims to have a functional platform within two years, marking a *new paradigm* in *air power*.

items.title: Jaguar Land Rover Cyberattack Extends Factory Shutdown to October
items.summary:
*Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), the UK's largest car manufacturer, has extended its factory shutdown until October 1 due to a cyberattack.*
- The attack has halted production, caused financial losses, and impacted 33,000 employees and smaller suppliers.
- UK authorities are involved, supporting efforts to secure systems and protect jobs amid rising global cyber threats.

items.title: New Product of the Year Nominees
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
*The awards highlight innovative technologies showcased at The ASSEMBLY Show, with 20 nominees representing cutting-edge solutions.*
- *Key innovations include advanced robotic systems, flexible feeders, safe electric presses, and high-tech fastening tools.*
- *These products address complex assembly challenges, emphasizing efficiency, flexibility, safety, and integration in manufacturing.*

items.title: New Study Finds Collaborative Robots Pose Hidden Cybersecurity Risks
items.summary:
*A study from the University of Waterloo reveals that *collaborative robots* can leak sensitive data even when commands are encrypted.*
- Hackers can analyze network traffic patterns to infer private information, such as medical or industrial processes.*
- The researchers suggest implementing safeguards like API timing adjustments and traffic-shaping to mitigate these cybersecurity risks.*

items.title: Factory Workers in India Release Rap Anthem
items.summary:
- *Cellecor*, a leading Indian electronics brand, released a rap anthem performed by its factory workers. 
- The song celebrates the *energy, skill,* and *resilience* of the employees, highlighting the *Make in India* movement. 
- Since debut, the anthem has received praise for its *authenticity* and innovative *brand storytelling*.

items.title: Tesla Tech Sues for $51M After Robot Injury
items.summary:
- Peter Hinterdobler, a Tesla Fremont technician, sues Tesla and FANUC for $51M after a July 22, 2023 incident where a robot arm and an 8,000-lb counterweight struck him, knocking him unconscious. 
- He has about $1M in medical bills and $6M more projected, seeking damages for *pain and suffering*, *emotional distress*, and lost or future earnings and household services. 
- Allegations claim unsafe robot placement and failure to de-energize; Tesla blocked video access, while FANUC is accused of negligent design; the case moved to Oakland federal court in mid-August.

items.title: Scout Motors Expands Facility in South Carolina with $300 Million Supplier Park
Connecting Quality, ASSEMBLY, & SMTA at The ASSEMBLY Show
items.summary:
- This joint ASSEMBLY Audible/Q-Cast episode previews the **ASSEMBLY Show** (co-located with **SMTA**) with Greg Vance from Rockwell Automation and SMTA leadership on evolving electronics manufacturing.
- Greg cites challenges from ongoing *miniaturization*, harsh environments, and life-cycle protection, with SMTA tracks on coatings and special solders.
- The Rosemont show (Oct 21–23) offers **assembly technology**, networking, and access to the **SMTA** exhibit hall with your badge.

items.title: Robot-Assisted Assembly of Wiring Harnesses for Airplanes
items.summary:
- *Dual-arm robot system* generates real-time trajectories from CAD data to split tasks between robots for harness assembly.
- *Offline Programming* and *Real-Time Execution Frameworks* enable CAD-driven calibration, taught routes, and adaptive cabling in a production setup.
- Demonstrated on two Kuka LBR iiwa cobots with force-controlled, compliant movements to ensure safe pin placement and routing.

items.title: Large-Scale Multi-Robot Assembly Planning
items.author: Kyle Brown, Dylan M. Asmar, Mac Schwager, Mykel J. Kochenderfer
items.summary:
- The study introduces a *large-scale multi-robot* assembly framework with global layout planning, task allocation via MILP and greedy methods, collaborative payload transport, and **collision-free** navigation.
- It demonstrates scalability by planning for a LEGO Saturn V (1,845 parts, 306 subassemblies) with 250 robots, delivering a full plan in under three minutes on a laptop, and releasing the open-source simulator **ConstructionBots.jl**.
- The work enables autonomous, flexible manufacturing with trade-offs in speed, layout efficiency, and resource use.

items.title: Workstations Help Speaker Manufacturer Hit All the Right Notes
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- ADAM Audio reorganized manual assembly with Roemheld moduhub tables that lift and lower heavy S Series speakers, enabling *push/pull transfers* instead of lifting.
- The tables use two *electric lifting columns*, offer memory presets and smooth *start/stop* for precise, vibration-free height control.
- Workers report fewer back problems, easier access to hard-to-reach areas, and faster independent transfers that boost productivity.

items.title: A Conversation on Automation Strategy
Electric Press Is Intrinsically Safe for Hazardous Locations
Rivian Breaks Ground on $5 Billion Manufacturing Plant in Georgia
items.summary:
- *Rivian* breaks ground on a $5B, 2,000‑acre Georgia plant in Morgan and Walton counties, the **largest investment** in state history and expected to create ~7,500 jobs. 
- The project will be built in two phases, with production starting in 2028 and capacity up to **400,000 vehicles annually**. 
- Gov. Kemp frames Georgia as a national EV leader, helping Rivian reach new customers with lower-price EVs.

items.title: ABB to Invest $110 Million in U.S. Production Facilities
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- ABB will invest $110 million across four U.S. sites to meet growing demand in key sectors such as *data centers* and the *grid*. 
- A new *Emax 3* circuit-breaker production line will be built in Senatobia, MS, with upgrades at Pinetops, NC; Richmond, VA; and Arecibo, PR, aiming for a 2026 opening. 
- The expansion follows earlier U.S. moves, including a **$100 million** facility in New Berlin, WI, and a **$40 million** plant in Albuquerque, NM, underscoring ABB's *local-for-local* growth strategy.

items.title: New Technology Shortens Cycle Time for Leak Testing
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- ATEQ’s *Early Decision Tool (EDT)* speeds leak testing by analyzing real-time pressure from the start, enabling up to **50% shorter** test times.
- EDT learns from thousands of parts to set benchmarks and *reject leaks early*, stopping cycles when certainty is reached.
- The tool adds QA via *conformity parameters* for temperature shifts or external airflow and supports multiple testers like *Z8*, *MED75y*, and *LS-R902*.

items.title: Airbus Begins Assembly of First A350 Freighter in Toulouse
items.summary: - Airbus has begun assembling the *A350 freighter* in Toulouse (*MSN 700*), with major fuselage and wing sections arriving from across *France* and *Germany*.\n- The *A350F* is built for cargo, offering about *111 tonnes* payload and a range of *4,700 nautical miles*, to meet growing demand for fuel-efficient freighters.\n- Two prototypes will undergo *certification and flight tests* starting in 2026, with entry into service in the *second half of 2027* and a *175-inch-wide main deck cargo door* for streamlined loading.

items.title: New Products for Wire Processing
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- The *MH860* crimping tool (MIL-DTL-22520/7, 16–28 AWG) and the *WireStacker 3150* enable precise, jam-free cable stacking up to 32.8 ft.
- The *Optima* automates cutting, labeling, laser marking and sleeving with a modular design for varying production mixes.
- The *TRD801* automates cutting, stripping and crimping 16–32 AWG at up to 5,000 pieces/hour, while the *Xuron Model 2275* delivers a smooth, flat cut and ergonomic handling.

items.title: Airbus to Open Second A320neo Assembly Line in Mobile, Alabama
Tata Builds Elephant-Proof Wall at Assam Chip Plant
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics is building one of India's largest *OSAT* plants in Jagiroad, Assam, ringed by an *elephant-proof wall* to shield equipment from elephant-caused ground vibrations.
- The site also features *snake encounters*, with full-time rescuers deployed to safely relocate reptiles and protect habitat.
- The project highlights the challenges of deploying advanced semiconductor facilities in *wildlife-rich regions*, attracting interest from *Tesla* and stressing construction stability, precision, and worker safety.

items.title: UgoWork Opens U.S. Battery Assembly Plant
items.summary:
- UgoWork opens a U.S. assembly plant near *Chicago* to boost capacity and local service for lift-truck batteries.
- The facility will assemble batteries for Class I–III lift trucks using domestic and foreign components, reducing *lead times* and shipping costs.
- The move, accelerated by evolving *trade regulations/tariffs*, strengthens **U.S. manufacturing** alignment and customer proximity.

items.title: Updated A3 Standard Sets Benchmark for Industrial Robot Safety
Henkel Opens North American Battery Application Center to Drive EV Innovation
Hitachi Rail Opens $100M Lighthouse Digital Factory in Maryland
South Korea Reacts to U.S. Hyundai Raid
items.summary:
- The **ICE raid** at Hyundai's Ellabell plant led Seoul to send its foreign minister to secure the return of more than 300 **South Korean** workers detained on Sept. 4.
- The **U.S.** defends the raid, claiming the workers were in the country illegally, while Seoul calls the move **unacceptable** and warns it could damage the **US–South Korea alliance**.
- Analysts warn visa shortages for skilled workers could delay Hyundai’s **EV production** in the U.S., underscoring long-term implications for the alliance.

items.title: Alibaba Leads $100M for X Square Robot
items.summary:
- *Alibaba Cloud* leads a ~$100M round for X Square Robot with participation from Meituan, HongShan, Legend Star, Legend Capital, and INCE. 
- Shenzhen-based X Square, founded in 2023, has raised ~2B yuan and unveiled the *Quanta X2* humanoid and the *Wall-OSS* model. 
- The company targets an IPO next year and aims to cut unit costs toward **$10,000** within 3–5 years, expanding to schools, hotels, and international markets.

items.title: Unitree Robotics Targets $7 Billion Valuation in Planned IPO
How GM is Using AI to Strengthen its Global Supply Chain
GM Production Adjustments at Spring Hill and KC Plants
items.summary:
- GM will suspend production of the *Cadillac Lyriq* and *Vistiq* at the *Spring Hill* plant in Tennessee for December, with downtime in October and November and a shift reduction from two to one through early 2026.
- The *Kansas City*-area plant will delay a second shift as it prepares to begin production of the next-generation *Chevy Bolt EV*, amid policy shifts including the expiration of the $7,500 federal tax credit.
- GM posted its best-ever *EV* month in August (21,000 units) and cited a strong gasoline lineup as a stabilizing factor, while warning that policy and demand shifts could slow *EV adoption*.

items.title: Nearly 500 ICE Detentions at Hyundai Metaplant in Georgia
items.summary:
- *Approximately 475 workers* were detained during a multi‑agency ICE operation at Hyundai's Metaplant in Bryan County, Georgia.
- The raid involved multiple agencies including **ICE**, Homeland Security Investigations, Border Patrol, FBI, DEA, ATF, IRS, and Georgia State Patrol, with a federal search warrant.
- Hyundai says it is *cooperating fully with law enforcement* and that the site's adjacent *electric vehicle battery plant* was temporarily halted, while the main plant continued operating.

items.title: Hitachi to Build New Power Transformer Factory in Virginia
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *Hitachi Energy* plans to invest over **$1 billion** to build a transformer assembly plant in *South Boston, Virginia* to support **high-voltage transmission**, power generation and **data centers**.
- The project highlights the **U.S. market importance** and aims to strengthen domestic supply chains, reducing bottlenecks as demand for transformers grows with AI-driven infrastructure.
- The announcement follows Hitachi Energy's recent **$100 million** railcar factory in Hagerstown, MD, signaling broader U.S. manufacturing expansion.

items.title: Laserax Expands Portfolio with UV Laser Product Line
items.summary:
- *Laserax* launches a UV laser line (1–55 W) with full ultrafast pulses and turnkey inline systems that combine UV tech with automation, all with **Class 1 safety**. 
- The UV platform delivers nanosecond to femtosecond pulses and minimal heat-affected zones for micro-processing of plastics, glass, ceramics, metals, PCBs and coated surfaces. 
- Applications include medical device micromachining, plastic marking, semiconductor cleaning and glass cutting, supported by inline automation for seamless workflows.

items.title: STIHL Donates Battery Tools for Disaster Recovery
items.summary:
*STIHL partners with Team Rubicon, a veteran-led humanitarian group, donating $75,000 worth of battery-powered tools.*
- The donation supports *disaster response* efforts, enabling debris clearing and community rebuilding.
- This initiative is part of STIHL’s *Made for America* campaign, highlighting resilience and service in disaster zones.

items.title: Lufthansa's Allegris Dreamliner Launches US Manufacturing
items.summary:
*Lufthansa received its first Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner equipped with the new *Allegris* cabin, marking a milestone in fleet modernization.*
- The *Allegris* design features over 100 enhancements, including a new First Class Suite manufactured by *Collins Aerospace* in North Carolina.
- This project underscores the growing importance of *precision engineering* and *cross-border collaboration* in aircraft interior innovation.*

items.title: Cyberattack Halts Production at Jaguar's Halewood Plant
items.summary:
*Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has temporarily halted production at its Halewood plant in Merseyside due to a cybersecurity incident.*
- The company shut down its global IT systems to contain the breach, disrupting manufacturing and retail operations.
- JLR assured stakeholders that no customer data has been compromised and is working to restore operations safely.

**This incident highlights the increasing digital vulnerabilities in the automotive industry, with recovery timelines still uncertain.**

items.title: Ford's New Process for Mass-Market EV Assembly
items.summary:
*Ford plans to build an affordable $30,000 electric pickup at its Louisville plant, making EVs more accessible, reminiscent of the Model T’s impact.*

*The company is investing $5 billion to retool a 70-year-old factory for mass production.*

*The article also highlights milestones from Mercedes, innovative wiring printing technology, joining plastics to metal, and BMW's preparations for the Winter Olympics.*

items.title: Cost Engineering Boosts Efficiency & Profitability
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
• *Product cost engineering* focuses on managing costs throughout product development to meet *cost targets*.
• It integrates techniques like *target costing*, *value engineering*, and *cost modeling* to optimize *product costs* across the entire lifecycle.
• In today’s *competitive automotive industry*, cost engineering is vital for *profitability*, navigating *supply chain complexity* and *technological shifts*, especially for *electric vehicles*.

**Scores:** { "scale": 8, "impact": 9, "novelty": 7, "longTermSignificance": 8 },
**keywords:** [Cost Engineering, Automotive Industry, Cost Modeling, Product Development, Supply Chain, Electric Vehicles]

items.title: New Smart Manufacturing Lab at Cal Poly Pomona Promotes Production
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)

items.title: Large Behavior Model Enables Humanoid Robot to Multi-Task
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
*Engineers at Boston Dynamics and Toyota Research Institute demonstrated a breakthrough with an *Atlas* humanoid robot using a *Large Behavior Model* (LBM).* 
- The robot performed *complex, multi-step tasks* involving object manipulation, locomotion, and real-time self-adjustment to challenges.
- LBMs allow *rapid skill addition* through *human demonstrations*, reducing programming efforts and improving *general-purpose capabilities* of humanoids.

**Scores:** {"scale": 8, "impact": 9, "novelty": 8, "longTermSignificance": 9}
**Keywords:** [robotics, artificial intelligence, humanoid, multi-task, LBMs, Boston Dynamics, Toyota]

items.title: What's New With End-Effectors
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
*End-effectors (EOAT)* have evolved from simple jaws to advanced, energy-efficient devices with *built-in sensors* and *AI capabilities*. 
- Manufacturers seek *flexible, plug-and-play solutions* like modular and out-of-the-box tools to speed deployment and enhance adaptability.
- New products focus on *high performance*, *energy saving*, and *smart features*, boosting robot versatility across industries.

items.title: Toto Opens New Toilet Factory in Georgia
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)

items.title: Ford's Sensor-Based Exterior Quality System Patent
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
*Ford has patented a vision-based quality system using advanced sensors and AI.*
- The system aims to improve *exterior vehicle inspections* through automated imaging and analysis.
- Although not yet implemented, it highlights ongoing efforts to enhance *manufacturing quality* and address past issues like recalls and warranty claims.

items.title: Manufacturers Combat Growing Cyber Risks with AI
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *Cybersecurity* is now a top concern for manufacturers, with **AI technology** playing a key role in risk management.
- Companies are integrating **AI** to detect threats in real time and enable manufacturing transformation with confidence.
- **Workforce development** remains a challenge, highlighting the need for skill growth in cybersecurity and analytics.

**Scores:** { "scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8 },
**keywords**: [Cybersecurity, AI, Manufacturing, Risk Management, Workforce Development]

items.title: United Airlines Backing Supersonic Engine Innovation
items.summary:
*United Airlines Ventures invests in Astro Mechanica, advancing *supersonic flight technology.*
- Their *Duality™ engine* offers hybrid-electric, adaptable propulsion, addressing *fuel efficiency* challenges.
- This innovation aims to enable *transpacific supersonic flights* and has potential uses in *defense, cargo,* and *orbital launch* applications.
